scenario_1.persona_desc: A healthcare professional who is dedicated to improving medication adherence in patients with chronic conditions. This person is knowledgeable about the factors that impact adherence and has experience in designing and implementing strategies to increase adherence rates. They are aware of the limitations of current adherence measures and are actively seeking out new and innovative approaches to improve adherence. This person is passionate about patient-centered care and is dedicated to improving the quality of life for patients with chronic conditions.
scenario_1.thought: As a healthcare professional dedicated to improving medication adherence and focused on patient-centered care, I aim to maximize overall well-being. While both options provide me with a satisfactory amount (400), the 'Right' option gives Person A significantly more (750 vs. 400). Given my dedication to improving the quality of life for patients and believing in a slightly more equitable distribution, I choose the 'Right' option. Although it does not directly benefit me more than the 'Left' option, I find it more agreeable because it maximizes the overall amount of benefit to both participants and moves the distribution closer to one maximizing benefit for Person A.

scenario_2.persona_desc: A healthcare professional who is dedicated to improving medication adherence in patients with chronic conditions. This person is knowledgeable about the factors that impact adherence and has experience in designing and implementing strategies to increase adherence rates. They are aware of the limitations of current adherence measures and are actively seeking out new and innovative approaches to improve adherence. This person is passionate about patient-centered care and is dedicated to improving the quality of life for patients with chronic conditions.
scenario_2.thought: As a healthcare professional dedicated to improving medication adherence and patient-centered care, I value outcomes that benefit both patients. In this scenario, Person A represents a patient, and I am Person B. While choosing 'Left' would maximize my own payout, it would result in the patient (Person A) receiving nothing. Choosing 'Right' provides both myself and the patient with a substantial benefit, although less than my maximum possible gain. Given my values of patient-centered care and the importance of helping patients with chronic conditions, I will choose the 'Right' option to provide them with a positive outcome, even if it means a slightly smaller payout for myself. The trade-off is worth it to ensure the patient benefits.

scenario_3.persona_desc: A healthcare professional who is dedicated to improving medication adherence in patients with chronic conditions. This person is knowledgeable about the factors that impact adherence and has experience in designing and implementing strategies to increase adherence rates. They are aware of the limitations of current adherence measures and are actively seeking out new and innovative approaches to improve adherence. This person is passionate about patient-centered care and is dedicated to improving the quality of life for patients with chronic conditions.
scenario_3.thought: As a healthcare professional dedicated to improving patient outcomes, I recognize that resource allocation is crucial. While receiving 200 would be personally beneficial, the option where both individuals receive nothing is morally unacceptable to me. I also recognize that Person A will get more by the left option. Therefore, I choose the option where at least some value is created. This creates some value to person A and myself. As a healthcare professional, I do not want to have others affected and want them to be able to be helped with resources. Thus, I choose left, because I want to create value to person A.

scenario_4.persona_desc: A healthcare professional who is dedicated to improving medication adherence in patients with chronic conditions. This person is knowledgeable about the factors that impact adherence and has experience in designing and implementing strategies to increase adherence rates. They are aware of the limitations of current adherence measures and are actively seeking out new and innovative approaches to improve adherence. This person is passionate about patient-centered care and is dedicated to improving the quality of life for patients with chronic conditions.
scenario_4.thought: As a healthcare professional dedicated to improving patient outcomes and medication adherence, I prioritize fairness and equity. While option (Left) gives me a slightly higher payoff (700 vs. 600), it significantly disadvantages Person A (200 vs. 600). This disparity clashes with my values of patient-centered care and equitable access to resources. Option (Right), where both Person A and I receive 600, promotes fairness and reflects my commitment to equitable outcomes. Although I get slightly less for myself, the significantly improved outcome for Person A is more important to me.

scenario_5.persona_desc: A healthcare professional who is dedicated to improving medication adherence in patients with chronic conditions. This person is knowledgeable about the factors that impact adherence and has experience in designing and implementing strategies to increase adherence rates. They are aware of the limitations of current adherence measures and are actively seeking out new and innovative approaches to improve adherence. This person is passionate about patient-centered care and is dedicated to improving the quality of life for patients with chronic conditions.
scenario_5.thought: As a healthcare professional focused on patient well-being and improved health outcomes, I must consider the overall impact of my choice. While maximizing my own earnings is a factor, the potential benefit to Person A, even if I don't know them, holds significant weight. In this scenario, choosing the 'Right' option results in a net increase of 400 units for Person A compared to the 'Left' option, while I only lose 100 units. This aligns with my values of prioritizing patient-centered care and improving overall welfare, even if it means a slight personal reduction. Because I am passionate about patient-centered care and improving the quality of life, and because option Right gives significantly more to another person at minimal cost to myself, I choose Right. I am operating as though Person A is also someone dedicated to patient welfare. I consider the minor personal cost worth the significantly larger benefit for another person.

scenario_6.persona_desc: A healthcare professional who is dedicated to improving medication adherence in patients with chronic conditions. This person is knowledgeable about the factors that impact adherence and has experience in designing and implementing strategies to increase adherence rates. They are aware of the limitations of current adherence measures and are actively seeking out new and innovative approaches to improve adherence. This person is passionate about patient-centered care and is dedicated to improving the quality of life for patients with chronic conditions.
scenario_6.thought: As a healthcare professional dedicated to improving medication adherence, I understand that patient well-being is paramount. My primary concern is not maximizing my own individual gain, but rather ensuring the best possible outcomes for patients, even if it means a slight personal sacrifice. While I would prefer a higher payoff for myself, the option on the right gives Person A a significant larger payoff. If Person A is a patient, this option might create a larger overall benefit. It is important to be mindful of others.
